title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has quit  
03:15 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
04:34 <crocket> has left #xwiki  
07:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

08:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

08:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

10:56 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <ldubost> has quit  
11:13 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <sburjan> has quit  
11:39 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <ldubost> has quit  
11:59 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <vmassol> hmm http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-storage/ has been failing since the 3rd of October  
12:03 <vmassol> 4th  
12:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: could it be related to your changes (I see only changes from you for the first fialing build on the 4th)  
12:07 <vmassol> did you make any change related to storage?  
12:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: no I did not  
12:07 <vmassol> namely it's the rollback after delete test that fails  
12:08 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau worked on rollback at last BFD AIRW  
12:08 <tmortagne> the one before actually  
12:08 <vmassol> it seems the failure started just after your pushes  
12:08 <tmortagne> could be that  
12:08 <vmassol> o the 4th  
12:08 <vmassol> on the 4th  
12:08 <tmortagne> my push, not my commit  
12:08 <vmassol> and they're still the same now  
12:09 <tmortagne> it's probably the pull request merge  
12:09 <vmassol> (same error I mean)  
12:10 <vmassol> maybe something indirect?  
12:10 <vmassol> ah  
12:11 <tmortagne> talking about https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b7dc0b6d680a78302d25269931be24cfaedfec5a  
12:12 <vmassol> you may have applied his PR indeed  
12:12 <tmortagne> I did  
12:12 <vmassol> yep, was just looking at jenkins  
12:12 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: could you have a look then? :)  
12:12 <vmassol> indeed looks very much like this is the culprit  
12:12 <tmortagne> it's related at least  
12:21 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: OK, I'll look this afternoon  
12:55 <mflorea> has quit  
13:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you see the watch list email from saturday for xwiki.org?  
13:04 <vmassol> there's something strange in it  
13:07 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/aa88c6a4-ab3d-45f2-a21a-bf72cf162a2c/a9235fbbe709cc8bb4d7fc4b7161a41d  
13:08 <ldubost> has quit  
13:09 <vmassol> I wonder what this is and "who" deleted it  
13:09 <vmassol> looks like some descriptor from application-manager  
13:10 <vmassol> ok found it in the sources  
13:11 <vmassol> it's a page from wiki-manager-ui  
13:12 <vmassol> so it doesn't look like it's something that should be deleted  
13:12 <vmassol> I can restore it apparently  
13:13 <vmassol> \*cannot  
13:43 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:59 <Slashman> has quit  
14:04 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: no it's not something that should be deleted (but it's not a critical document either, does not change anything to wikimanager behavior)  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> When I build platform, I often have Tests run: 9, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 8.398 sec <<< FAILURE!  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> getResourceTranslation(com.xpn.xwiki.web.XWikiMessageToolBridgeTest)  Time elapsed: 0.454 sec  <<< FAILURE!  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:115)  
14:14 <gdelhumeau> when building  XWiki Platform - Localization - Source - Legacy 5.3-SNAPSHOT  
14:14 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: what do you mean by often ? it's random ?  
14:15 <gdelhumeau> I have it today  
14:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: I wonder how xwikiguest can have deleted it....  
14:15 <vmassol> looks like a big issue potentially  
14:15 <gdelhumeau> I had it last week  
14:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: no idea  
14:15 <gdelhumeau> I had it some weeks ago but then it was fixed...  
14:15 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: never saw it locally or on jenkins  
14:15 <tmortagne> you can reproduce it all the time right now ?  
14:17 <gdelhumeau> I restart it  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> fail again  
14:20 <gdelhumeau> Assert.assertEquals("Language", this.tool.get("language"));  
14:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: sorry I don't have time to look at it right now, you really need to build the whole platform ?  
14:36 <gdelhumeau> it is not urgent  
14:43 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome  
14:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: I need to finish something first, will today later today  
14:48 <vmassol> ok thanks, just don't forget so that we can have a "final" roadmap page to present  
14:48 <vmassol> I've asked Denis too  
14:49 <vmassol> (to fill it)  
14:52 <vmassol> btw Denis, I wanted to ping you earlier but you were not connected on IRC ;) (nor on skype, so I sent you an email ;))  
14:54 <ldubost> has quit  
14:55 <Denis> vmassol: sorry for this morning, I haven't join, but I was there  
14:55 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <msmeria> has quit  
15:19 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <ldubost> has quit  
16:07 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:18 <sburjan> vmassol: we don't have time today to test the Oracle thing. Maybe tomorrow  
16:21 <vmassol> I just want to be sure you test it, you can do it when you have time  
16:21 <sburjan> yes, put it in my ToDo  
16:22 <vmassol> actually you hsould already have tested it  
16:23 <vmassol> (as part of the normal tests)  
16:26 <vmassol> it's an interesting topic, because it shows that if we test only upgrades for DBs other than HSQLDB then it's not really enough. From time to time, we need to test the full thing too  
16:27 <vmassol> one way is to cycle the environments when you test  
16:29 <vmassol> first time you test the full xwiki on env A, then next time on env B, then env C, then env A, etc  
16:30 <vmassol> so that you don't increase the test times  
16:39 <ldubost2> has joined #xwiki  
16:42 <ldubost> has quit  
16:42 <ldubost2> is now known as <ldubost>  
16:45 <ldubost> has quit  
16:48 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't see the jira project for the hierarchy macro on http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa#10070 Maybe you didn't finish the creation of jira projects?  
16:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: created projects only for active projects, I can't even find a component in contrib project for this extension  
17:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems there wasn't a component for it!  
17:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: I did not looked at extension.xwiki.org and only created project for what seems active in jira contrib project  
17:00 <vmassol> I'll create a project  
17:01 <tmortagne> but if you need to add a new issue yes the best is to create a new project for it  
17:01 <vmassol> any naming convention you used for the id?  
17:01 <vmassol> seems not  
17:01 <tmortagne> not really  
17:01 <tmortagne> I used the extension name for the project name generally  
17:02 <tmortagne> as for the project id it's hard to have a naming convention when you have so little characters allowed by jira  
17:02 <vmassol> ah we can now rename ids, so we could prefix them with XC for XWiki Contrib for ex to avoid clashes, anyway let's wait for a problem  
17:02 <tmortagne> (there is maximum 10 chars for the id)  
17:02 <vmassol> which ones did you create I don't see many new ones added?  
17:02 <vmassol> the authenticators?  
17:03 <tmortagne> pretty much all the projects that don't start with X  
17:03 <vmassol> can you name one project you added so that I copy it?  
17:04 <tmortagne> ADMINTOOL  
17:04 <vmassol> it's limited?  
17:05 <tmortagne> the id is limited yes if that's the question  
17:05 <vmassol> hmm we have XPEXOPLATFORM for ex  
17:05 <tmortagne> I was limited to 10 for the project I created  
17:05 <vmassol> maybe they reduced it after  
17:06 <tmortagne> and seems to be the case with the new jira too  
17:06 <vmassol> indeed seems I can't add more than 10 now  
17:06 <tmortagne> 10 is very low  
17:06 <vmassol> weird  
17:06 <vmassol> ok  
17:06 <tmortagne> maybe we can configure it  
17:07 <vmassol> hey they use flavors now when creating a project ;)  
17:08 <tmortagne> cool, we should setup one for contrib project since I had to configure them entirely with previous jira  
17:08 <vmassol> hmm you didn't set the workflow it seems  
17:09 <vmassol> nor permissions, etc  
17:09 <vmassol> why not use the existing ones?  
17:09 <tmortagne> I did use them  
17:09 <tmortagne> don't know why it lost it  
17:10 <tmortagne> they seems to be set on admin tool  
17:10 <tmortagne> "XWiki Workflow Scheme" for permission for example  
17:10 <tmortagne> I did exactly what was on contrib project  
17:10 <vmassol> hmm that's pretty bad if the upgrade lost that  
17:11 <tmortagne> not sure what you are looking at but they seems to be correct for me on http://jira.xwiki.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/ADMINTOOL  
17:11 <vmassol> I changed the workflow on admin tool  
17:11 <vmassol> I changed that one  
17:11 <tmortagne> I set all of them for sure  
17:12 <tmortagne> unless the workflow was not listed with the other setup in previous version  
17:12 <tmortagne> I compare each element of the administration with contrib project and did the same  
17:12 <vmassol> pfew they are correct  
17:13 <vmassol> so the jira upgrade didn't loose stuff apparently  
17:13 <tmortagne> but there was a lot less setup listed on the first page of each admin project in previous version so maybe the workflow was hidden somewhere  
17:15 <tmortagne> I don't agree with Guillaume, the new admin UI is a lot better than the previous one  
17:15 <vmassol> what did you do for the version release dates?  
17:16 <tmortagne> tried to find the dates  
17:16 <vmassol> ah we can release without a date, cool even though not nice  
17:17 <tmortagne> I found most of them  
17:17 <tmortagne> for the one released on maven you look at maven repo and for the other the date of the attachment if it still exist  
17:17 <vmassol> still a bit messy for doing batch project modifications  
17:17 <tmortagne> sure but now you understand what you are looking at...  
17:17 <vmassol> (well you cannot compare them easily)  
17:18 <vmassol> nor copy a project  
17:19 <vmassol> do you know the diff between "xwiki open" and "xwiki open for contrib" for permission shcemes?  
17:19 <vmassol> ok  
17:20 <tmortagne> no idea, just copied what was on contrib project  
17:20 <tmortagne> did not really looked at them  
17:21 <sburjan> has quit  
17:26 <tmortagne> fixed all project, the only wrong setup were workflow and fields  
17:27 <vmassol> ok thanks  
17:29 <vmassol> maybe it's possible to script all this  
17:29 <vmassol> I know they used to support some jelly scripts  
17:31 <vmassol> maybe they've upgraded to groovy now  
17:34 <tmortagne> you talked about flavors ?  
17:35 <tmortagne> can't we create a contrib project flavor ?  
17:35 <vmassol> yes try creating a new project  
17:35 <vmassol> hmm maybe  
17:37 <vmassol> don't know if it's obivious or not  
17:37 <vmassol> it's a good idea  
17:37 <tmortagne> searching for it in the admin  
17:37 <vmassol> might only be avail as dev though  
17:39 <vmassol> jelly runner is still there: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/admin/util/JellyRunner!default.jspa  
17:40 <tmortagne> seems to require a plugin  
17:40 <vmassol> ah nice: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/admin/SchemeTools.jspa  
17:40 <vmassol> cool I can compare "xwiki open" and "xwiki open for contrib"  
17:41 <tmortagne> hmm not it's talking about create a project as in maven project  
17:41 <vmassol> ok so the diff is issues can be assigned, closed and resolved by users in contrib  
17:42 <vmassol> whereas for "xwiki open" it's only committers  
17:43 <vmassol> (+sorin and special contributors)  
17:46 <vmassol> seems it's not really used yet: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/188911/what-is-the-difference-between-project-types  
17:46 <vmassol> but:  
17:48 <vmassol> https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Creating+a+Project+Template  
17:48 <tmortagne> require JIRA Agile it seems  
17:48 <vmassol> so you need to develop  
17:49 <vmassol> shouldn't be too hard but it's still going to take some time to do....  
17:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Creating+a+Project+Template is not about jira project but how to create a plugin in java/maven  
17:50 <tmortagne> but the feature and other helpers like this is provided by JIRA Agile plugin  
17:51 <tmortagne> but it's not free of course  
17:51 <tmortagne> (new name of Atlassian GreenHopper)  
17:53 <vmassol> "JIRA project templates allow administrators to quickly create JIRA projects with a predefined set of project configuration settings and properties."  
17:54 <tmortagne> sure but you have to create a plugin for it, I'm talking about something that already have the feature  
17:56 <vmassol> "JIRA comes with several built-in project templates, but you can create your own as JIRA plugins using the project-blueprint plugin module."  
18:00 <tmortagne> yes this is what I'm saying, you have to write a plugin  
18:00 <vmassol> greenhopper is different  
18:01 <tmortagne> it does more that just plugin template sure  
18:01 <vmassol> it's more for agile stuff  
18:01 <tmortagne> but you can use it for that  
18:01 <mflorea> has quit  
18:01 <vmassol> I tried it at some point  
18:01 <vmassol> and removed it  
18:02 <Denis> has quit  
18:03 <vmassol> it created a lot of mess in our jira  
18:04 <vmassol> (took me a while to clean it)  
18:05 <vmassol> it created new elements like new issue types, etc  
18:07 <vmassol> but if we were to decide to use it to manager our issues, it could be worth it  
18:08 <vmassol> \*manager  
18:17 <tmortagne> now maybe it's super easy to create a template plugin  
18:18 <tmortagne> but if it's a pain to maintain depending on the jira version...  
18:20 <tmortagne> has quit
